THE EDISON SITE AS OF JUNE 2 2006 HAS TWO OCCUPANTS, BASELL USA INC AND W.R. GRACE. BASELL IS THE SITE OWNER AND OPERATES ONE LARGE PROCESS, GRACE OWNS THREE OF THE SITE BUIDLINGS AND RUNS THE OTHER PROCESSES.  BASELL PROVIDES A BROAD NUMBER OF SERVICES TO GRACE INCLUDING UTLITIES, MAINTANENCE AND SOME EHS SUPPORT.  TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE ALL EHS PROGRAMS APPLY TO ALL SITE OPERATIONS AND BOTH BASELL AND GRACE ARE CO-OWNERS OF THESE PROGRAMS.  THE GRACE OPERATIONS AT THE EDISON LOCATION USE AMONG OTHER MATERIALS TITANIUM TETRACHLORIDE AND ISOPENTANE, BOTH OF WHICH ARE REGULATED SUBSTANCES.  GRACE ACTIVITIES ARE FOCUSED ON CATALYST MANUFACTURING AND THE PREPARATION OF BLENDS OF SPECIALTY ORGANICS.  THE OPERATIONS CONDUCTED BY GRACE EMPLOY BOTH REGULATED SUBSTANCES AS RAW MATERIALS AND SIGNIFICANT QUANTITIES OF BOTH ARE STORED ON SITE.  BOTH MATERIALS ARE ALSO PRESENT IN A NUMBER OF PRODUCTS MANUFACTURED AT THE SITE.                                                                                                                  BASED ON STATE, FEDERAL AND COMPANY INFORMATION KNOWN TO GRACE THE PORTION OF THE SITE OPERATED BY GRACE HAS NOT HAD ANY REPORTABLE ACCIDENTS IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS  INVOLVING REGULATED MATERIALS OR COVERED PROCESSES. GRACE HAS NO IMMEDIATE SPECIFIC PLANS TO IMPROVE SAFETY AT THE FACILITY BUT WILL REVIEW AND AUDIT ALL SAFETY PROCEDURES & PRACTICES IN USE AND APPLICABLE TO GRACE OPERATIONS, WITH THE COOPERARTION OF BASELL STAFF, AND  WILL MODIFY OR REVISE WITH THE OBJECTIVE BEING TO MAKE THE LOCATION SAFER, THOSE SAFETY PROCEDURES IDENTIFIED AS REQUIRING SOME LEVEL OF IMPROVEMENT. A SIMILAR PRACTICE WILL BE ADOPTED FOR EQUIPMENT AND PROCESSES.
THE SITE HAS A RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WHICH MEETS THE REQUIRMENTS OF OSHA-PSM, EPA-RMP, NEW JERSEY - TCPA AND THE ACC RESPONSBILE CARE GUIDELINES. THE SITE IS AN OSHA VPP STAR AND ITS QUALITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGMENT SYSTEMS ARE CERTIFIED FOR ISO 9001 STANDARDS.  GRACE IS IN THE PROCESS OF OBTAINING BOT

H VPP STAR AND ISO 9001 CERTIFICATION.

THE PROCESS SAFETY INFORMATION, DOCUMENTATION AND UPDATING FUNCTIONS ARE ASSIGNED TO DIFFERENT PERSONNEL ON SITE BASED ON EXPERTISE AND ASSIGNED RESPONSBILITIES. SOME FUNCTIONS ARE GENERAL SITE ROLES AND ARE PERFORMED BY BASELL PERSONNEL, OTHER PROGRAMS THAT ARE GRACE SPECIFIC ARE MAINTAINED BY GRACE PERSONNEL.  THIS INFORMATION AND DOCUMENTATION WILL INCLUDE MSDS, JOB ANALYSES, SOPS, CONFINED SPACE AND LINE BREAKING PROCEDURES AND PERMITS, ALONG WITH EQUIPMENT, AREA AND PROCESS DESIGN AND SPECIFICATION DOCUMENTATION.

PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSES FOR EXISTING PROCESSES ARE CONDUCTED ON A FIVE YEAR SCHEDULE BY SUITABLE PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS TEAMS.  NEW PHAS WILL BE PERFORMED AS REQUIRED. THE TEAMS ARE COMPOSED OF A TEAM LEADER, PERSONNEL HAVING KNOWLEDGE OF PRODUCTION AND MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES AND A PRODUCTION OPERATOR.  NORMALLY THE HAZOP AND WHAT-IF CHECKLIST METHODS ARE EMPLOYED.  THE COMPLETION OF RECOMMENDATIONS ARE TRACKED BY AN ELECTRONIC DATABASE.  THE GRACE PROCESS TECHNICAL SPECIALIST IS RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENENTATION OF THIS RMP ELEMENT.  THE PHA WILL ADDRESS ALL REQUIRED ELEMENTS OF A PHA INCLUDING HAZARDS, PREVIOUS INCIDENTS, CONTROLS, HUMAN AND FACILITY FACTORS, AND CONSEQUENCES OF FAILURE.  ALL DOCUMENTATION FOR GRACE PHAS WILL BE MAINTAINED BY THE PROCESS TECHNICAL SPECIALIST.

THE STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOPs) ARE WRITTEN AND UPDATED BY THE PROCESS AND PRODUCTION ENGINEERS.  THE SITE GRACE SITE MANAGER IS REPOSNBILE FOR ENSURING SOPS ARE KEPT CURRENT.  FULL SOPs ARE AVAILABLE TO RELEVANT PERSONNEL AND SANTIZED SOPs ARE AVAILABLE TO ALL SITE PERSONNEL.  ALL SOPS WILL INCLUDE AT THE MINIMUM CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE SAFE OPERATION OF ALL EQUIPMENT AND PROCESSES. THIS WILL INCLUDE BOTH NORMAL AND EMERGENCY CONDITIONS, OPERATING LIMITS AND CORRECTIONS, ALONG WITH THE SAFETY AND HEALTH CONSIDERATIONS FOR THE CHEMCIAL AND EQUIPMENT HAZARDS OF THE PROCESS.

OPERATOR TRAINING FOR GRACE PERSONNEL IS COVERED BY

TWO PROGRAMS.  THE BASELL COMPONENT COVERS ALL SITE PROGRAMS AND THIS PROGRAM IS PLANNED, IMPLEMENTED  AND TRACKED BY THE BASELL SAFETY & TRAINING MANAGER.  GRACE PROCESS AND OPERATIONS SPECIFIC TRAINING IS IMPLEMENETED AND MAINTAINED BY THE GRACE PROCESS TECHNICAL SPECIALIST.  THE TRAINING MATERIALS FOR BOTH PROGRAMS COULD INCLUDE MANUALS, VIDEO TAPES, COMPUTER LEAD LESSONS, OVERHEADS, FIELD EQUIPMENT AND LECTURES.  ANY ONE OR ALL OF THESE TOOLS MAY BE USED.  THE TRAINING ACTIVITIES ARE TRACKED BY A TRAINING DATABASE. AT THE MINIMUM THE OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM WILL INCLUDE AN OVERVIEW OF THE PROCESS, OPERATING PROCEDURES, SAFETY AND HEALTH HAZARDS, EMERGENCY OPERATIONS AND SAFE WORK PRACTICES.

MECHANCIAL INTEGRITY AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENACE PROGRAMS WILL BE A GRACE RESPONSBILITY BUT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED BY BASELL. THE ENGINEERING MANAGER (BASELL EMPLOYEE) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MECHANICAL INTEGRITY PROGRAM.  THE GRACE PRCOESS TECHNICAL SPECAILIST IS THE LIASON BETWEEN GRACE AND BASELL FOR THIS PROGRAM. THE PRORAM CONSISTS OFA PROGRAM MANUAL, EQUIPMENT LISS & SPECIFICATIONS, EQUIPMENT HISTORY FILES, PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES AND AN AUTOMATED WORK ORDER SYSTEM.  WORK PERMITS, ENTRY PERMITS AND HOT WORKS PERMITS HAVE BEEN INCORPORATED INTO THE SAFETY PROCEDURES MANUAL.  YEARLY REPORTS ARE ISSUED TO VERIFY THAT ALL REGULATED EQUIPMENT IS TESTED AND INSPECTED AS PER THE DOCUMENTED PROGRAM.

THE SITE SAFETY & TRAINING MANAGER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SITE MANAGEMENT OF CHANGE (MOC) PROGRAM.  AT THE LOCAL LEVEL THE GRACE PROCESS TECHNICAL SPECIALIST IS RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENTATION.  THE MOC PROGRAM FOLLOWED IS DETALIED IN THE SITE SAFETY PROCEDURES MANUAL.  A COMMITTEE OF PROCESS AND OPERATIONS PERSONEL REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL MOCs.  COMPLETION OF ALL ACTION ITEMS RESULTING FROM AN MOC REVIREW ARE TRACKED ELECTRONICALLY.

SITE COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE COORDINATED BY THE PQC MANAGER.  COMPLAINCE AUDITS WILL BE PERFORMED IN TWO

DIFFERENT MANNERS.  AT THE LOCAL LEVEL TEAMS OF BOTH GRACE AND BASELL SITE PERSONNEL WILL PERFORM ONE LEVEL OF AUDITS.  AT A HIGHER LEVEL CORPROATE OR CONSUTLANTS WILL BE EMPLOYED BY GRACE TO EVALUATE APPLICABLE REGULATION COMPLIANCE  DEFECIENCIES AND RECOMMENDED CHANGES FROM BOTH TYPES OF AUDITS WILL BE TRACKED BY AN ELECTRONIC DATABASE AND LOCAL MANAGERS WILL BE RESPONSBILE FOR CORRECTIVE ACTIONS.

GRACE WILL FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE EXISTING THE SITE INCIDENT INVESTIGATION PROGRAM. THIS PROGRAM CONSISTS OF A DETAILED PROCEDURES AND ALL INCIDENTS ON SITE ARE INVESTIGATED.  THE LEVEL OF INVESTIGATION AND PERSONNEL INVOLVED IN THE INVESTIGATION PROCESS IS DETERMINED BY THE CLASSIFICATION OF THE INCIDENT. ALL REGULATED CHEMICAL RELEASES AND NEAR MISSES OR POTENTIAL INCIDENTS ARE INVESTIGATED BY A TEAM OF PERSONNEL INCLUDING THE AREA SUPERVISOR AND THE MANAGER OF SITE SAFETY AND TRANINING. ROOT CAUSES ARE DETERMINED AND CORRECTIVE ACTIONS ARE IDENTIFIED AFTER INCORPORATION OF INFORMATION FROM ALL PARTICPANTS.  FINAL REPORTS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO SITE SUPERVISORY PERSONNEL WHO IN TURN REVIEW THE REPORTS WITH THEIR EMPLOYEES. ALL ACTION ITEMS ARE TRACKED AND COMPLETION IS DOCUMENTED USING AN ELECTRONIC DATABASE.

THE SITE HAS A VERY DETAILED EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION PROGRAM OF WHICH GRACE WILL BE FULLY INVOLVED AS EQUALS. THIS PLAN DESCRIBES IN DETAIL THE MAJOR REQUIREMENTS OF ALL ELEMENTS OF THE RMP AND THE RESPONSBILITIES OF VARIOUS EMPLOYEES AND HOW ALL OTHER SITE PERSONNEL ARE INVOLVED. THIS PROGRAM IS IMPLEMENTED BY THE BASELL PQC MANAGER.

THE CONTRACTOR PROGRAM FOLLOWS STANDARDS ESTABLISHED BY OSHA PSM AND NJ TCPA REQUIREMENTS.  THE PROGRAM IS IMPLEMENTED BY THE BASELL SITE SAFETY AND TRAINING MANAGER.  ALL CONTRACTORS EMPLOYED BY GRACE WILL BE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW THIS SITE PROGRAM. 

THE SITE HAS A PROGRAM FOR HOT WORK PERMITS AND GRACE WILL FOLLOW THIS PROGRAM.  AS GRACE WILL ABIDE BY ALL SITE PROCEDURES FRO HOT WORKS PERMITS.  THIS PROGRAM WILL BE IMPLEMENTED BY GR

ACE AALTHOUGH ALL PERMITS WILLB E ISSUED BY BASELL PERSONNEL, AND WORK PERFORMED BY BASELLPERSONNEL, CONTRACTORS APPROVED BY BASELL AND GRACE OR UNDER BASELL SUPERVISION.

AT THE MINIMUM GRACE W ILL FOLLOW ALL EXISTING PROGRAMS AND PROCEDURES FOR SAFETY REVIEWS  FOR BOTH EQUIPMENT AND PROCESS DESIGN AND FOR START-UPS. 

RELEASE PREVENTION METHODS IN USE ON THE GRACE PORTION OF THE FACILITY INCLUDE RELIEF VAVLES, RUPTURE DISCS, VENTS, CHECK VALVES, SCRUBBERS, QUENCH SYSTEMS, AUTOMATIC SHUTOFFS, INTERLOCKS, GROUNDING, KEYED BYPASSES AND PURGE SYSTEMS.  MITIGATION SYSTEMS INCLUDE DIKES, BERMS, SPRINKLERS, SUMPS, WATER CURTAINS, HAZAMAT FOAMS, MINERAL OIL DUMP SYSTEMS AND NEUTRALIZATION. MOST OF THE PROCESS AREAS ARE MONITORED BY LEAK DETECTION AND LARM SYSTEMS FOR TOXIC AND FLAMMABLE GASES. OPERATOR ARE TRAINED BOTH INTIALLY AND ON A PRESCRIBED REPEAT BASIS. THE PM AND MECHANCIAL INTEGRITY PROGRAMS CONDUCT EXTENSIVE INSPECTIONS ON EQUIPMENT INCLUDING ON PREVENTIVE DEVICES. THE MOC PROCEDURE ASSURES THAT ALL CHANGES TO SYSTEMS ARE REVIEWED FOR HAZARDS PRIOR TO THEIR IMPLEMENTATION. ALL INCIDENTS ARE INVESTIGATED TO DETERMINE ROOT CAUSES AND COORECTIVE ACTIONS ARE IMPLEMENTED TO PREVENT FUTURE INCIDENTS. 

THE SITE EMEGENCY PROGRAM MEETS THE REQUIRMENTS OF THE EPAS INTEGRATED CONTINGENCY PLAN GUIDANCE. THE PLAN DEFINES THE RESPONSE ORGANIZATION, COORDIANTION WITH LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE COMMITTEES, EQUIPMENT, RESPONSE PROCEDURTES, TRAINING, NOTIFICATION PROCESSES AND DRILLS. THE PLAN IS REVIEWED AND UPDATED ON A REGULAR BASIS AND AS A RESULT OF ANY DEFECINCIES OR RECOMMENDATIONS RESULTING FROM SITE DRILLS OR INCIDENTS. 

THE SITE WILL MAINTAIN ONE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM TO BE MANAGED BY THE BASELL MANAGER OF SAFETY AND TRAINING THAT WILL COVER ALL SITE OPERATIONS.  GRACE PERSONNEL WILL BE FULLY INCORPORATED INTO THIS SITE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.  ALL GRACE OPERATORS WILL TAKE AND PARTICPATE IN THE TRANINING REQUIRED OF ALL SITE OPERATORS.  GRACE PERSONNEL WILL B

ECOME MEMBERS OF THE SITE RESPONSE TEAM.  THE HAZARDS AND RESPONSE TECHNIQUES TO MITIGATE PROBLEMS IN  GRACE OPERATIONS WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE SITE RESPONSE TRANINING AND PROCEDURES. ALL GRACE PERSONNEL WILL BE TRAINED IN SITE EMERGENCY PROCEDURES.
